summary: CalendarSpec components for hour and dayOfMonth are encoded with incorrect validation ranges, rejecting valid values. Hour field accepts 0-59 instead of 0-23, and dayOfMonth accepts 0-6 instead of 1-31.
userImpact: Users cannot create temporal schedules with valid calendar specifications, as legitimate dayOfMonth and hour values are rejected with validation errors.
rootCause: Validation range checks in makeCalendarSpecFieldCoders use incorrect upper bounds: hour field checks x <= 59 instead of x <= 23, and dayOfMonth field checks x <= 6 instead of x <= 31.
proposedFix: Change hour validation from (x >= 0 && x <= 59) to (x >= 0 && x <= 23) and dayOfMonth validation from (x >= 0 && x <= 6) to (x >= 0 && x <= 31).
workaround: Patch node_modules/@temporalio/client/src/schedule-helpers.ts with the provided diff to correct the validation ranges.
resolutionDetails: Issue was fixed by correcting the validation range checks for hour (0-23) and dayOfMonth (1-31) fields in schedule-helpers.ts
keyQuote: Error: Invalid CalendarSpec component for field dayOfMonth: '21' of type 'number'
